title.narrative: Operational support for Multi sectoral emergency response in Gogrial and Yirol East.

description.narrative: This project is to support the operational costs for Caritas Norway funded projects SSD233 (Gogrial) and SSD232 (Yirol). The projects in question will adopt an integrated multisectoral approach that will focus on providing appropriate lifesaving relief support. This will include initiatives that help communities in transitioning to self-reliance and build resilience to reduce future vulnerability in Gogrial and Yirol East States. Focus will be on targeted humanitarian assistance, enhancing gender equality, improving protection needs of women, girls, boys and persons living with disability, psychosocial support, GBV case management, peace building, improving participation of women in peace building dialogues and decision-making processes, WASH and building the resilience of communities to crises. Ongoing conflict has given rise to many challenges in South Sudan, not least food insecurity and displacement. Women and girls are affected in particular, with protection issues and sexual and gender-based violence faced by many women, who are disproportionately affected by conflict. This is true in Gogrial and Yirol East, the proposed project locations of this intervention. A multi-pronged approach is required to address the challenges. Women, men, girls and boys require lifesaving interventions to meet their food, protection, water, sanitation and hygiene needs and to build resilience to reduce future vulnerability.
